verses.text: What advantage then hath the Jew? or what profit \add is there\add* of circumcision?
Much every way: chiefly, because that unto them were committed the oracles of God.
For what if some did not believe? shall their unbelief make the faith of God without effect?
God forbid: yea, let God be true, but every man a liar; as it is written, That thou mightest be justified in thy sayings, and mightest overcome when thou art judged.
But if our unrighteousness commend the righteousness of God, what shall we say? \add Is\add* God unrighteous who taketh vengeance? (I speak as a man)
God forbid: for then how shall God judge the world?
For if the truth of God hath \add more\add* abounded through my lie unto his glory; why yet am I also judged as a sinner?
And not \add rather\add*, (as we be slanderously reported, and as some affirm that we say,) Let us do evil, that good may come? whose damnation is just.
What then? are we better \add than they?\add* No, in no wise: for we have before proved both Jews and Gentiles, that \add they\add* are all under sin;
as it is written, There is none righteous, no, not one:
there is none that understandeth, there is none that seeketh after God.
They are all gone out of the way, they are together become unprofitable; there is none that doeth good, no, not one.
Their throat \add is\add* an open sepulchre; with their tongues they have used deceit; the poison of asps \add is\add* under their lips:
whose mouth is full of cursing and bitterness:
their feet \add are\add* swift to shed blood:
destruction and misery \add are\add* in their ways:
and the way of peace have they not known:
there is no fear of God before their eyes.
Now we know that what \add things\add* soever the law saith, it saith to them who are under the law: that every mouth may be stopped, and all the world may become guilty before God.
Therefore by the deeds of the law there shall no flesh be justified in his sight: for by the law \add is\add* the knowledge of sin.
But now the righteousness of God without the law is manifested, being witnessed by the law and the prophets;
even the righteousness of God \add which is\add* by faith of Jesus Christ unto all and upon all them that believe: for there is no difference:
for all have sinned, and come short of the glory of God;
being justified freely by his grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus:
whom God hath set forth \add to be\add* a propitiation through faith in his blood, to declare his righteousness for the remission of sins that are past, through the forbearance of God;
to declare, \add I say\add*, at this time his righteousness: that he might be just, and the justifier of him which believeth in Jesus.
Where \add is\add* boasting then? It is excluded. By what law? of works? Nay: but by the law of faith.
Therefore we conclude that a man is justified by faith without the deeds of the law.
\add Is he\add* the God of the Jews only? \add is he\add* not also of the Gentiles? Yes, of the Gentiles also:
seeing \add it is\add* one God, which shall justify the circumcision by faith, and uncircumcision through faith.
Do we then make void the law through faith? God forbid: yea, we establish the law.
